number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												Dead  Space 1 and 2Where to start. That they both are excellent survival horror games, that both are filled with immersion and that they both have great narrative and story. Those are just few thing Dead Space 1 and 2 have gotten right.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Dead Space 1Dead Space 1 was very atmospheric and i was scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ for the first 4 hours of the game. + Lots of replay value+ Doesnt contain many jumpscares, it rather scares you with its tense and horrifying atmosphere+ Good story with good characters (nuff said)- Some annoying "puzzles" in the last few chapters-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Dead Space 2Dead Space 2 had a great narrative and plot. Gameplay was only improved, cool new enemies were added and Isaac was back, better than ever.+ Gameplay was slightly more action packed but i had its scary moments aswell. A great balance between them to be correct+ DS2 is full of thrilling and intense moments. + The narrative was better this time and Isaac voiced made him instantly more likable.- I experienced some annoying bugs (weapons disapearing, infinite loading screen) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Something both games have in common+ Superior sound design (necromorphs sound so damn scary)+ Excellent survival gameplay+ Graphics looked fairly good even today when using ReShade graphical mod+ So much replay value-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------VerdictIf you like scary games, if you like survival horror, if you like atmosphere and if you want a good plot from a game.Go grab youself a Dead Space 1 and 2Dead Space 1 - ( 9.4 )Dead Space 2 - ( 9.7 )One word... Amazing

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												I own Dead Space franchise on Origin, but everyone knows how it is with Origin and its game selection and community hub. Dead Space 2 is the overall the best sequel (already fantastic) game could wish for. Everything is bigger, better, darker, heavier, smoother. Story wise it's not a miracle and there are some plotholes, however the (bigger and darker) backstory around the Markers makes up for it. Controls are much more smoother actually enabling to play with mouse and keyboard, graphics is better (and thus looks still good even after four years since the game was released) and for me sadly Isaac got a voice :( However, as I found out by rebuying these games, Dead Space 1 and 2 are games that don't get very old and everyone can enjoy them even now, in 2015 and on. You can always start the game on harder difficulty with different weapons combo and completely ignoring the telekinesis, which is probably the most important game mechanic in this sequel of one helluva atmospheric game. Now gimme DS3 on Steam ^.^

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												They retained everything, that was good in the first game, and added another shovel of them in the second. I actually found Dead Space 2 more of a horror game then 1, apart from what the generality says, because of the games far more depressive enviroment and the more frequent jumpscares, or the intense cutscenes, which ads a lot to the whole feel of the game. The game is ballanced nicely, you always know what to do to survive in an event of a massive necromorph attack, you always gonna get the enough nodes, ammunition, money, and information to progress in game, and when you don't you always gonna have to use your head as just as many times as necessary for the game to not become frustrating or boring. (But what will be boring after a while is the grinding for nodes to upgrade even more your rig, and your weapons) I don't know that it is just me, or they did upgraded some kind of a way the engine of the game, it somehow runs much smoother, easier then Dead Space 1. There was a bug in the first episode; the "w" on my usb keyboard sometimes "missed out", but in this episode i did not experience even a little technical issue. Great job Visceral! I'll give it a 92/100 . If you liked Dead Space 1, you're gonna super-like Dead Space 2, so i'm very much recommending to go on, buy it, because it's worth the 10 Euros.

There was a bug in the first episode; the "w" on my usb keyboard sometimes "missed out", but in this episode i did not experience even a little technical issue. Great job Visceral! I'll give it a 92/100 . If you liked Dead Space 1, you're gonna super-like Dead Space 2, so i'm very much recommending to go on, buy it, because it's worth the 10 Euros.

												I love Dead Space 2. Why? Great gameplay, great story, great graphics, interesting settings, vicious creatures, the occasional scare and some really f*****d up moments that I really enjoy. The nice thing about Dead Space 2 on PC compared to the original on PC is that the port of DS2 is actually very good. It looks good, and it runs very smoothly. I use to own this game on PS3, and got it on Steam awhile back shortly after I got my new PC. The PC version is obviously better. The 30 hrs playtime I have is running through the game twice, and some time in the online multiplayer mode. The online death match mode is fun, too. Nothing amazing or deep, but a nice distraction. So if a game that is kind of a mixture Resident Evil 4 and Metroid (series) sounds like a good time... then I recommend Dead Space 2.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												Dead Space 2 isn't really that scary. It's far, far too silly for that. Everyone is made from plasticine and jam, stomping on corpses will completely detach limbs (and yield treasure!), and you'll shoot room fulls of zombie children and watch as their arms and legs go flying everywhere. This game is so gratuitous, most of the time all you can do is laugh.Put simply, it's more the second half of Aliens than Alien. Dead Space 2 is mostly interested in having you shoot monsters and throwing buckets of gore at the screen. Which it does very well. There's a brief section two thirds of the way through where the game takes a breather to build some tension, but for the most part it's wall to wall necromorph blasting. And it's excellent.Just don't expect scares more complex than a corpse coming to life followed by a necromorph jumping out of a vent for the 437th time and a row.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												I've had this game for years but somehow always managed to forget about it. However I'm glad I finally came around to play and finish it because it's a great game. Graphically it's still a good looker, even in 2015 (though the textures on the armor could be a little bit better /nitpicking ), the sound design is amazing and more than once the eeriness was kept by only the music. That said this one isn't as scary as the first one mainly because of two reasons. The first one being is that now Isaac knows what's happening around him (you also know that he pretty much kicks♥♥♥♥♥ and the second one is that in some parts of the game, instead of carefully constructed encounters, the enemy monsters just keep on coming, so it's more action oriented. Another negative aspect is that sometimes the game takes away the control from the player (these are not cinematic but in game scenes) and you can't skip them or do anything at all. Thankfully it only happens a couple of times and they're not long at all.So the question is: would I recommend it? Definitely, even if my review seems harsh, I still enjoyed my time with it.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												A terrifying game, it's jumpscares are very predictable, yet they still manage to keep you on the edge of your seat.It has you checking every corpse in sight with a ranged gunshot to make sure that they're not going to reanimate and slice your body apart.The horror within this game cannot be described with mere words, videos and images are enough to keep you on edge, but being inside the game immerses you to the point where you almost emulate the fear that the player is enduring, a truly shocking experience.You play as Isaac Clark(e?) in the aftermath of Dead Space 1's events, you are lead to believe that you have a mental issue which can be cured if you listen to who is talking to you, both Isaac's ambition to survive the odds given rise to by these messages and your own ambition to run through the blood still keeps you going through the game, despite the offputting level of horror and terror.Excruciatingly terrifying at a certain point where Isaac re-enters the USG Ishimura, only to be met by a swarm of unstoppable necromorphs which swarm him like wasps, the paranoia you feel when you hear a distant necromorph, thinking you've killed them all, and you think they're too far away to reach you in time, but just as you go to run, it's fangs are buried in your leg is undescribable.Most definately a game that gets you thinking; you constantly run in to obstacles which enable you to use your mind to utilize many game mechanics such as Telekinesis and freezing, you are able to freeze certain obstacles in time to ensure that they don't slice you in to millions of pieces as you crawl towards your objective.Do I reccommend this game? absolutely! but it is not for the weak of heart, nor for those who find themselves constantly ragequitting in every game they play.Watch your step, don't turn around unless you hear a ♥♥♥♥ing noise, and most certainly never think that you're alone.

												Dead Space 2 is nothing short of a masterpiece.Beautiful visuals with a great artistic creativity and focused but strong utilization of color throughout. One of the best PC ports created, will run good even on low end systems. Improves upon the first game significantly in terms of gameplay flow, features, enemies, weapons, mechanics. Tense but typically fast paced gameplay.Highly recommend, even if you did not enjoy the first or third game. (Played elsewhere many times)

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												story-story of dead space 2 follows isaac clarke who  is in asylum and has amnesia is awakened by Franco Delille and he is there to help,but before he could cut you out of your straight jacket he s been.....infected i guess  by a necromorph so he transformed to one before isaac eyes (wow.asylum,awakening with amnesia and character thats there only to be suddenly killed,that s 3 horror clichés in a row.)of course you escape and then your getting help by daina,but she betrayes you  because of some cult stuff and you are told that you created a new marker,you escape and your goal is to destroy markerthe first thing i consider a problem in this horror game is that...its not that scaryok,there are  frightening or disturbing moments ,but there are not lot of them and most of the times its all ruined by isaacs voice acting(and by voice acting of everyone else).in a first game he didnt talk,but here he does and he  sounds like an action hero and its distracting,other characters are not that interesting and some would really fit into an action movieand also some jumpscares are lame(for example that fake sun jumpscare)gameplay-even though its kinda lame as an horror game,its actually pretty fun action game,you have again plasma cutter   and you can now impale enemies with help of telekenisis(you have also other guns like flamethrower, impale gun,etc and you can also upgrade them)of course you can also use stasis that slows enemies and its really helpfullalso in certain places you can shoot  the glass so enemies are going to be sucked outand there are even parts where youre going to float in the air because of low gravity(those parts are pretty cool)music is quite decent and graphics are greatto sum up-as a horror game it doesnt (mostly there are some scary parts but there arent lots of them)work,but as an action game its really good,so yeah its kinda like re4-most of the time you wont be scared but youre going to have lots of fun with it7,5/10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												I didn't really like the first Dead Space, the movements were slow, some of the levels were a little too hard, mostly the levels with turrets involved. I spent the most of the play through using the plasma cutter. I even posted a negetive review, about how the story was a bit bland. But after going to the end, I was surprised at the twist at the end, it was refreshing. But the sequel is so much better! Smoother movements, more weapons, more armor, SO much better zero-g game play. The fast that Isaac is now a vocal character and actually is a character that serves to drive the story forward besides just killing stuff was a little off putting at first, but I got used to it fast. And I have a weakness for totally bad♥♥♥♥♥ass kicking, super hot girls with subtle british accents, (Miranda Lawson was my weakness), and Ellie is an awesome character. I'm only on chapter 9, but the fact that you can mow down hoards of deranged deformed children, shot kamakazie babies and make them explode, and nobody asks any questions... just makes this game so far above par it's stupid. Awesome game!

												One of the best games I have ever played, let alone a sequel that completely belittles its predecessor. The envionrment is always changing, there are a good amount of enemy types, the game never feels like a grind, there are plenty of surprises, and you feel like a badass in the engineering suit. content:
Posted: December 7, 2015
												This is definitely a good game. But unfortunately it's worse than Dead Space, I understand why - beating such quality is not an easy task. The atmosphere and core gameplay is still here in Dead Space 2 and tweaked to a certain extent, some things have been improved and honestly I don't have much negativity to say about it, maybe just that it's way too similar to Dead Space? Like it's a bad thing, huh? Enemy variety makes things interesting when you encounter new necromorphs and trying to establish some new strategies versus them.So, what's worse then? Pretty much everything else. It's not entirely bad it's just sub par or worse than what Dead Space offered:Very simplistic level design. There's no map this time and it's not even needed there's almost always only one door to enter.Level transitions are usually a QTE/Action scenes which leaves you wondering where the hell you ended up this time, usually you'll partially understand this by reading logs and/or from random intercom messages from various characters. For example in Dead Space there was a monorail and in the wagon you could see a ship scheme so that you understand better where are you heading right now. In Dead Space 2 it's just a sp@stic (this word is censured, wtf steam?) chaos and you'll never be able to fully understand Isaacs route. Characters are much less likable and some are stupidly annoying, like one of the antagonists which always spams your intercom with cheesy threats, like "NOW IT'S OVER!" or "YEAH, NOW IT'S DEFINITELY OVER!" when it's obvious that it's not... All other characters are "meh" as well, and their further development is rather disappointing. On a plus side Isaac brakes his numb record from Ishimura and now talks, sometimes even way too much.Plot is, well, it's much less intriguing to say the least. It's just covers nothing interesting and doesn't really develop Markers/Necromorphs story either. You won't find any bosses in this game, that's really disappointing.On top of that - last part of the game is just big a run-through, dodging some re-used hobo from the original and his friends. That is really really lazy. In Dead Space there was that Marker delivery trip with a lot of fighting and ended up in an amazing boss fight for instance.The good thing is that atmosphere is still pretty grim, new weapons spicing up gameplay in a different ways, RIGs now have special effects and kinesis module is now an awesome tool to kill necromorphs very fast. Now you can freely fly around in Zero Gravity, which is very cool. 5 Difficulty levels this time around with hardcore mode which allows to have only 3 saves throughout the whole game and no checkpoints, it's pretty cool, harder difficulties forces you to use environment to your advantage not just shoot in everything that moves since you'll run out of supplies very fast that way.  Basically - the gameplay is the only thing here that you shouldn't worry about, it's here, it's tweaked and won't disappoint.Dead Space 2 is not a masterpiece like Dead Space, it thrives on the elements of the original game and doing very little to be called a masterpiece on it's own. I still recommend everyone to play it since the quality of this game is astounding and it's a rare thing these days.7/10.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2014
												This game certainly has some oddities to it (aka bugs but I wouldn’t' call them bugs), such as DLC content being available in the in game store even though I don't have the dlc which kinda made the start of the game easier as the guns/suits cost nothing which you shouldn't have available. I didn't mind though, it gave me variety in what I got to use so I'm not complaining.I never even clicked multiplayer and also I only played this game through once so no idea what those add to the game, I really didn't care about those. I will say I really enjoyed this game, it was probably the first game I found genuinely scary in a long time. When you're not getting over run by aliens jumping right in your face and still advancing even after you shoot their legs off (using their claws) you are wandering around paranoid to hell waiting for them to swarm you. Some really nicely done aliens in here that remind me of the raptors in the kitchen on Jurassic Park (film) where you are getting hunted. You can hear them making noises somewhere in the dark and then you see what looks like a head peaking around behind a box but as you go to shoot it runs back behind and sprints off. Damn packs of the things zipping round really fast, leaping over large containers and jumping at you is quite scary.Some parts got very irritating when I kept dying, particularly when I died after a silly animation scene type thing and had to watch the stupid thing each time. Also I found the end very hard (and at times a bit frustrating) when I kept dying and had to wait for it to load all the time (even with an SSD it wasn't the fastest). I played through on 'survivalist' which I think is the 'hard' option,All in all I did enjoy this and it was scary throughout and I tend not to find things scary. I bought this in a sale and it lasted about 12 hours so well worth whatever I paid for it. There is game mode+ which would extend it's life, it's an oldish game now so I can't see multiplayer adding anything now. I don't really play single player games more than once but you get extra stuff one new game+ which will add for some people. I never played Dead Space 1 and I felt I didn't miss anything from not knowing the previous story.See this in a sale, pick it up.

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												The “Previously, on Dead Space” video is a nice touch, though it reminds me how similar Dead Space 2's premise and gameplay are to the last one. This time Isaac Clarke awakens on a facility on Saturn's moon Titan, three years after the rescue-mission-gone-awry on the mining ship Ishimura, and finds a very familiar situation: Titan is overrun with space zombies called Necromorphs that have set about the meticulous dismemberment of everyone in sight—and he's still having hallucinations of his dead girlfriend.It also highlights that DS2 is a better sci-fi horror game, in a lot of subtle but important ways. While the plot is similar, the storytelling technique has changed for the better—Isaac has recovered from a bout of Gordon Freeman Syndrome (inexplicable muteness), and the voice performances are excellent. But the real star is the environment: for the entirety of the eight-hour campaign, Visceral does an expert job of making you feel in constant peril, alternating between tingling your spine with unsettling scenery and audio and trying to rip it out of your body by way of horrific monsters. This is what happens if you play Twister during the space-zombie apocalypse.New bloodFighting a Necro is different from other videogame enemies, in that shooting its head is like shooting a grizzly in the foot—it barely slows it down, and just makes it angrier. Picking off limbs takes them down quicker, requiring multiple accurate shots per target—which makes the smooth controls greatly appreciated.DS2 has a zoo's worth of different varieties of spitting, charging, wall-crawling nasties (including evil space-babies), and each puts up a hell of a fight. The first time I was hunted by the new Stalkers was one of the most frightening moments of the game—I caught a shadowy movement behind some crates out of the corner of my eye, but I found nothing there. I heard a chirping noise, and spun around to see a velociraptor-like creature charging toward me. With a scream it smashed me to the floor, then nimbly darted away, intelligently using cover to escape before I could hit its legs. Then, more chirping—and I realized I was surrounded. Clever girl. Stalkers are swift, agile pack hunters. Also, they're jerks.Most of the 15 stages have a unique look to them (as unique as possible given that they're mostly metal corridors), from the wrecked residential areas to the Necro-worshiping Unitologist temple to the EarthGov zone, and they're punctuated by floaty zero-G areas. You have all the same tools as before—the upgradable Rig suit is equipped with time-slowing and telekinesis powers—but the levels are designed well and don't overuse any one gimmick. That includes enemies that must be defeated by blasting their glowing yellow bits.The new multiplayer owes a lot to Left 4 Dead's example: four human players fight their way through a gauntlet of objectives while four class-based Necro players and AI-controlled backup zombies assail them from all sides. It's fun, and produces some nail-biting finishes, but aside from making you unlock equipment with experience (which I don't personally care for), it doesn't do anything we haven't seen before. No you idiot, don\'t shoot it in the head!Overall, besides retaining the irritation of having to seek out a save station to avoid losing progress when I want to quit, DS2 is a smartly improved version of the original. It's not a new experience, but it's a hair-raiser nonetheless.THE VERDICT90/100Dead Space 2An excellent action-horror sequel. Dead Space 2 doesn’t try to innovate, but it’s a highly polished alien-rending experience.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												★★★★★★★★ Review Time ★★★★★★★★★★(Mungkin agak telat reviewnya LOL , game ini keluaran tahun 2011 dan baru saya main kan minggu ini XD)Game Action Survival Horror dari Developer Visceral Games memang patut di acungi jempol. Kompleks Cerita dimulai dari Dead Space pertama yang sukses mendongkrak pamor dari game ini .  Dead Space 2 menceritakan 3 tahun setelah tragedi Dead Space yang pertama.  Isaac Clarke  (tokoh utama) berhasil lolos dari insiden USG Ishimura yang mana dia bertahan dan melawan makhluk alien yang bernama Nechromorphs.Isaac Clarke di Dead Space 2 ini memang menjadi tumpuan musibah . Bayangkan, baru saja game ini di mulai, kita akan di suguhkan cuplikan adegan mengerikan dari kebrutalan Necromorphs. Tidak cukup disitu saja, di pembukaan game ini kita pun harus survive dari kejaran Necromorphs dalam keadaan tangan terikat. Belum lagi game ini disuguhkan dengan Kualitas grafik , detail karakter dan lingkungan , atmosfer , dan soundtrack yang membuat anda lebih baik diam di tempat daripada melanjut kan misi >_<Necromorphs berbeda dengan zombie menurut saya, biasanya di game game yang lain anda cukup menembak kepala saja. Berbeda dengan Necromorphs, menembak kepala saja tidak cukup, anda harus memotong dan menghancurkan tubuh dari Necromorphs itu sendiri XD .Necromorphs di Dead Space 2 ini juga bervariasi, ada yang lambat dan memiliki damage besar, ada yang memiliki kecepatan yang bahkan membuat anda kewalahan mengahadapi nya, ada yang berbentuk mekanisme seperti bom dan ranjau, dan  ada yang mampu menembak kan zat asam.Di Dead Space 2 ini anda masih bisa membeli beberapa ammo, armor, health pack dan  senjata dalam melanjutkan petualangan selanjutnya. Anda cukup mengumpulkan coin dari hasil membunuh Necromorphs atau mendapatkannya dari menjelajah ruangan. Tidak cukup sampai disitu, Dead Space 2 juga ada sistem Upgrade, seperti Upgrade senjata, health dan lain lain. Anda cukup mengumpulkan power node yang berada random di ruangan atau membeli di Shop .Armor di game ini layak nya seperti di game RPG, karena setiap armor memiliki efek dan fungsi masing masing. Ada yang menambahkan efek ke Health, ke Weapon atau ke Armor itu sendiri.Weapon di Dead Space 2 ini pun juga bermacam ragam, ada Plasma Cutter, Heavy Duty Detonator, Agility Rivet Gun, Forged Line Gun dan masih banyak lagi.Oh iya, dalam menggunakan Weapon ini juga ada beberapa mode, mode normal hanya menembakkan seperti biasa, dan mode Space. Ketika anda menggunakan weapon, cukup tekan tombol Space, dan mode dari weapon akan berubah dengan sendiri nya, seperti contoh Forged Line Gun dalam mode normal akan menembakkan listrik , dan ketika mode Space, akan menembak kan ranjau listrik yang akan meledak dalam beberapa detik.Untung nya di game ini di lengkapi dengan Locator yang dapat menunjukkan posisi Save , Bench (Upgrade), Shop dan Objektif selanjutnya . |Setiap arah dari Locator ini dibedakan dari beberapa  warna  seperti warna biru menunjukkan Objective, kuning menunjukkan Shop, Ungu menunjukan posisi Bench, warna hijau menunjukkan posisi Save StationPercayalah , Fitur ini amat sangat membantu kita dalam menamatkan petualangan Isaac Clark. Selain itu masih ada fitur yang menjadi tambahan dalam game ini. Yakni Gadget Kinesis. Fungsi dari fitur ini adalah dapat mengangkat benda benda, tubuh  dan objek lain nya ke udara, juga dapat melemparkan ke arah yang kita mau. Nah, inilah yang menjadi Weapon cadangan. Jika anda kekurangan Ammo, anda tidak perlu cemas. Cukup cari berbagai benda, seperti besi tajam dan angkat menggunakan Gadget Kinesis dan lemparkan ke Necromorphs. Juga ada mode modul Statis. Fungsinya apa? Fungsi mode ini dapat memperlambat gerak suatu objek. Misal pintu Lift, cukup anda tembakkan , dan otomatis Pintu Lift tadi menjadi lambat pergerakanya. Mode ini juga berguna sekali dalam misi, misal anda juga kekurangan Ammo, cukup anda tembakkan modul statis ke objek itu, maka Necromorphs akan bergerak lambat. Disinilah action Punch dan Injakan dapat membunuh Necromorphs.Puzzle juga ada di game ini, gunakan mode Gadget Kinesis dan modul Statis agar mempermudah anda menyelesaikan puzzle tersebut.Visual efek yang menjijikan, Soundtrack yang membuat ngilu kaki untuk melangkah, mekanisme gameplay yang cepat, Panorama Luar Angkasa dan Futuristik yang menjadi nilai tambah game ini, Rentetan Story yang ciamik. Game ini sangat WORTH untuk dimainkan bagi anda pecinta horror game yang ingin memiliki pengalaman berbeda.Nilai dari saya 9/10 Info :  Pertengahan game sempat membuat membuat saya Pusing dan Mual. wkwkwkwkwk XD

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												97/100The game is even better than the 1st one.I found a few minor bugs that I think prevent me from giving it a perfect score.Bug 1: When you enter into the stores, and you pull your weapon out... you cant see the amount of ammo you have in the weapon.Bug 2 : You never have to worry about if an enemy is dead because you can EASILY tell they are dead by using kinesis on them.  It sort of ruins the surprise when you have a foolproof way of knowing when your enemy is not dead.  On the other hand, maybe this isnt a bug... but it certainly does rain on the old phrase "when in doubt, stomp it out" since there is NEVER any doubt that an enemy is alive or dead with the kinesis trick.Since dead space 1 gave me no trouble on the regular setting and I thought it was too easy, I decided to play this one on the hard setting the first time through... and this one is notably more difficult, but it also probably has to do with my choice to upgrade the pulse rifle and line beam as my top weapons.  I should have stuck with my plasma cutter.Best weapons:1) Plasma Cutter (favorite from last game too)2) Ripper (actually, very versatile, way more useful than it was in the first game... only problem is you gotta get up close... so you pretty much need full kinesis for this to be effective, bad against the guys that freeze you and guys that blow up... good against everything else, can beat really powerful bosses with 2-4 blades and a couple kinesis blasts)3) Seeker Rifle (powerful, but slow... bad in close quarters)4) Detonator.... (this is easily the best weapon to use against the most difficult to deal with enemy in the game, which are these guys who stalk you and do organized attacks)5) Force gun (good versus almost all enemies, especially when being swarmed or in close quarters, not so good in open spaces)6) Flame thrower (better option than the pulse rifle... handles similarly, isnt a piece of crap like it was in the first game)7) Line Gun (powerful if you aim it right)8) Pulse Rifle (lots of ammo, but very weak, not good against the stalkers)9) Contact Beam (good, slow, doesnt carry a lot of ammo, must have good aim)10) Javelin (slow, powerful)11) Rivet gun (total piece of crap, dont know why they even bothered including it in the game)The rivet gun is basically useless.For chapter 15(last level), the ideal 3 weapons to bring are:1) Ripper (to get through the hoards of enemies and regenerating ones)2) Force gun or line gun(force gun is better)... to keep the little enemies from swarming you during the final boss battle.3) And the Seeker rifle OR Javalin... for the final boss itself.But in reality, the plasma cutter is so versatile it is the overall best weapon to bring if you can only afford to take one(which should be the case in your first playthrough).In your first playthrough.. you want to focus on upgrading your suit(only 1 air upgrade is really necessary, if even), your kinesis, and your plasma cutter... and then spend the rest on a second weapon upgrade(maybe the force gun or line gun for the last boss)Like in the first game: Make sure you upgrade capacitiy for weapons when you are empty on ammo(before reloaded) or when you are low... you will get a free ammo refil.Same goes for health: upgrade health capacity when you are low on health(free health refill).Also: buy a new suit when you are low on health(free health refill)

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Probably the best game in the franchise. The game is not nessessarily that scary for a "survival horror" game but gameplay overall is very good. Controlls are tight, there are some pretty good custimization options with weapons and suits, and Isaac has a voice this time (voice acting is top notch in my opinion). The campaign is a good length and the story is better than most games I've seen though somewhat predictable. If you want the full "survival" experience try playing this on the hardest difficulty. Unfortunately the horror part isn't really there all that often but fortunatly that is the only down side. The game gets to be much more of a shooter in the late game. Saddly this may be the last good dead space game as they really dropped the ball with the third game. I reccomend that you also play the original dead space which is more survival horror so get the bundle, and get it while it's on sale. This is probably one of my all time favorite games.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2015
												Jesus where do I even start with this game. One of the best horror games I've ever played. The atmosphere and the whole survival aspect really does stick to this game more than a burger to a fat guy's mouth. Holy ♥♥♥♥. If you are a huge fan of the horror genre and have not played this game, you need to buy this game or else you will be missing out. Really. Just nothing can put into words on how amazing this game is. Great storyline, not just a one of those "they throw you in a room and you have to survive for no reason." The shooting is one of the best aspects of the game. Weapons are varied and if you fail to use the right weapon for right mob you will get srewed over. Mistakes punish you harder than you can imagine. Misposition yourself in the slightest and you are welcome to the death screen. This is a gamer's game, you will die alot. But where Dead Space truly does shine is its survival aspect from the necromorphs. It really does make you feel like you are a helpless engineer struggling to survive and it's what most horror games lack these days. Hearing the horrifying screech of a necromorph at the end of a dark corridor will make you regret ever taking that babie's lollipop once you look around the corner. And last but not least surviving a level or two is greatly safistying. I can't tell you how many times and how much my heart raced whenever I got ambushed by a squad of three. Once you chop of one of the limbs it makes you feel as though you are a butcher who murders, in a good way though.Overall, just pick up this game. Definetly worth full price.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Dead Space 2 is a third person survival horror as you play as Isaac Clarke, a man who has endured a mental condition who must fight against necromorphs and alien species in attempt to reach Diana. A woman who can cure his mental issue. This game has a decent plot with the feeling of dread,agony and pain. A lot of pain. The shooting is executed nicely, using the Resource Intergration Gear to assist you. The shooting is innovative, including a vast amount of gore for the sensation of horror and suspense. The gore can be a bit overwhelming but it's considered creative and it makes the shooting much more addictive. Dead Space 2 is rememberable for the blood but not for it's emotional characters and gameplay. Some chapters do feel repetitive at times or the objective just felt pointless. The scenery is a bit too bland for me, causing me to loss interest in some chapters. Dead Space 2 had some positve touches of third-person shooting that most games don't bring to the table but I really wish it was more emotional for the story it held.  Sometimes cinematic/emotional touches can uplift the intensity or emotion of a game but they failed to do so. Along with some of the missions feeling dull, they kept you on your feet with amusement being properly used when needed. If you like the sight of blood....or shooting unique creatures in the eyes, you will most likely enjoy this game. If you're expecting anything more...don't purchase it. I'll give it a 7.1/10

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												97/100The game is even better than the 1st one.I found a few minor bugs that I think prevent me from giving it a perfect score.Bug 1: When you enter into the stores, and you pull your weapon out... you cant see the amount of ammo you have in the weapon.Bug 2 : You never have to worry about if an enemy is dead because you can EASILY tell they are dead by using kinesis on them.  It sort of ruins the surprise when you have a foolproof way of knowing when your enemy is not dead.  On the other hand, maybe this isnt a bug... but it certainly does rain on the old phrase "when in doubt, stomp it out" since there is NEVER any doubt that an enemy is alive or dead with the kinesis trick.Since dead space 1 gave me no trouble on the regular setting and I thought it was too easy, I decided to play this one on the hard setting the first time through... and this one is notably more difficult, but it also probably has to do with my choice to upgrade the pulse rifle and line beam as my top weapons.  I should have stuck with my plasma cutter.Best weapons:1) Plasma Cutter (favorite from last game too)2) Ripper (actually, very versatile, way more useful than it was in the first game... only problem is you gotta get up close... so you pretty much need full kinesis for this to be effective, bad against the guys that freeze you and guys that blow up... good against everything else, can beat really powerful bosses with 2-4 blades and a couple kinesis blasts)3) Seeker Rifle (powerful, but slow... bad in close quarters)4) Detonator.... (this is easily the best weapon to use against the most difficult to deal with enemy in the game, which are these guys who stalk you and do organized attacks)5) Force gun (good versus almost all enemies, especially when being swarmed or in close quarters, not so good in open spaces)6) Flame thrower (better option than the pulse rifle... handles similarly, isnt a piece of crap like it was in the first game)7) Line Gun (powerful if you aim it right)8) Pulse Rifle (lots of ammo, but very weak, not good against the stalkers)9) Contact Beam (good, slow, doesnt carry a lot of ammo, must have good aim)10) Javelin (slow, powerful)11) Rivet gun (total piece of crap, dont know why they even bothered including it in the game)The rivet gun is basically useless.For chapter 15(last level), the ideal 3 weapons to bring are:1) Ripper (to get through the hoards of enemies and regenerating ones)2) Force gun or line gun(force gun is better)... to keep the little enemies from swarming you during the final boss battle.3) And the Seeker rifle OR Javalin... for the final boss itself.But in reality, the plasma cutter is so versatile it is the overall best weapon to bring if you can only afford to take one(which should be the case in your first playthrough).In your first playthrough.. you want to focus on upgrading your suit(only 1 air upgrade is really necessary, if even), your kinesis, and your plasma cutter... and then spend the rest on a second weapon upgrade(maybe the force gun or line gun for the last boss)Like in the first game: Make sure you upgrade capacitiy for weapons when you are empty on ammo(before reloaded) or when you are low... you will get a free ammo refil.Same goes for health: upgrade health capacity when you are low on health(free health refill).Also: buy a new suit when you are low on health(free health refill)

content:
Posted: February 12, 2016
												Dead space 2 takes what was good in the first game, pretty much everything and then fixes most of what was bad in the first game, which was the controls and fov and makes a much better sequel that is dark, fun, and you get to shoot up ugly monsters all over the place! What can be better! Just like the first game, the visuals are amazing, even better in DS2. Like mentioned before the controls have been fixed to actually have a fun playable experience that is smooth and fun, very unlike DS1. You go through an amazing set up experiences, great cutscenes and launches into different areas such as anti-gravity, space, vents and tunnels and much much more.Now saying that, yes there are still problems with DS2. You are limited on weapons and armor due to your small inventory space so you normally have to focus on 1 weapon, maybe 2 max instead of enjoying the variety of weapons that the game introduces you to. You have the ability to upgrade your weapons and armor and unlike other games, you don't find "better" items later usually, so your fully upgraded weapon is going to be your main weapon for most of the game, because if you find something else it isn't upgraded with 20-30 nodes and is vastly weaker, so why even use it. There is also still the horrible problem with the sound. The sound is great in the game except when it comes to talking and understanding what people are saying. Normal speech is fine but lots of scenes, cutscenes, they try and do "monster" voices and such, and they are 100% not able to be understood, which ruins the reason for actually trying to say something in the first place. Way to much "scary" modulation which makes the speeches just babble.Still very good game, finally good controls, just wished for better inventory management so you could enjoy all the weapons equally instead of having to wait until new game+'s to use them.

content:
Posted: February 9
												Dead Space 2:Positives:+ Good shooting, lots of guns to choose from - fun!+ Graphics greatly improved from Dead Space, holding up fine even to 2017 standards.+ Controls and mouse sensitivity are actually decent, unlike Dead Space.+ I didn't experience any motion sickness with Dead Space 2, one of my primary complaints with the first title in the series. Sounds strange that I need to label this as a pro, but given how horrific it was, I'm glad I can actually enjoy Dead Space 2.+ Interesting futuristic sci-fi atmosphere.Mixed ~ Story is nice, but a bit hard to follow. I had to read a plot summary on google after finishing it to fully understand the events.Negatives:- Same alien species from the first game, nothing really new here.- Just like its predecessor, Dead Space 2 is a poor example of horror fiction. You'll get very minimal jump scares, there's nothing frightening about the environment. Wimps and ignorant fanboys will, of course, suggest it is "super spooky", when in fact it isn't.- Dead Space 2 tries too hard to be clever, with unoriginal, lame puzzles and annoying, repetitious quick time events where you need to "react fast or die". Not smart or cool game design.7.5/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												So, Ive played the first original dead space (Most of it, not all), and Ive played dead space 2 for the Xbone, and now I would like to contribute what I have learnt from this game.First things first, Ive got a pretty out dated PC (Its a newish PC, the drivers are pretty bad, wont even attempt launching OverWatch), I can play it fullscreen with a decent 45-60 frames low quality, I could probably do high at the same rates, but I'm fine with how it is now. If you have outdated drivers, chances are you can run this pretty well, so don't fret about that.Second thing, gameplay is the most important thing alongside the question "Can you run this game". Now this is gonna be the part that destroys this game, ONLY FOR PC. So I started up, decided to do some hard mode for a challenge. About 20 minutes in, Isaac still doesn't have his suit yet, and I'm running around, doing pretty well. Finally get to the shop, and I open it up to buy the suit, first thing- let me rephrase that, multiple things that I see, the whole arsenal of weapons and suits are available to me, 0 CREDITS. Now, the first thing that went through my mind was- "Oh, all of this stuff has to be unlocked first, yeah." and so just to test it, I bought a Earth pulse rifle. Got the weapon, full clip. Now, second thing that went throught my mind was- "Oh, all of this is supposed to be unlockable, why is this existing right now?" and just like that, went online, "Why are all the dead space 2 items free", and apparently the problem was there was a patch previously, and it was a attempt at fixing a bug where you would have to buy items twice to actually get what you paid for. So, naturally, I bought literally everything and equipped the most OP weapons for the up coming boss fight. About 2 minutes later, the boss was obliterated, no sweat. Special side note, this patch exists ONLY for the PC version, Xbone doesn't have this problem, I've played both Xbone and PC now.This is actually really disapointing because it really kills the fear factor to the game when you're literally just a walking tank, you're pretty much unstoppable, especially if youre a good shot, but that could be said with any gun. When you get to the second store, things actually cost money, only default and ammunition items do though.Anyways, third and last place, the story. Story is pretty confusing so far, however most of the time with horror games, I don't care about story, I just like the atmosphere when it isn't DESTROYED by broken patches. I've heard there is a patch online somewhere, but people say it's either really annoying to install or is broken still.IIINNnn conclusion, if you enjoy horror games that make you fight to survive with a challenge, buy this on xbox instead of PC, but if you enjoy horror games that turn out to be Just Cause, definitely buy this.

content:
Posted: April 21
												Overall great game, here are a few details:-Good graphics, could've been better for the year in which it was released but still fine. Also well optimized.-Interesting gameplay, staying true to it's prequel's model. TPS based, puzzle minigames like hacking, well interpreted recoil, overall fluid and perfect for a horror game.-Well written story with likeable characters and without a Gary Stue-ish protagonist. Also has a badass female character so feminists can't get triggered.-The horror aspect is on-point, as there's a constant feel of unease throughout the entire game, always keeping a tense athmosphere and never failing to remind players that jumpscares come when you least expect them.Sadly the multiplayer for it and every other Gamespy-based titles is dead, though in this case it's not as much of a loss compared to games like Crysis.An honest 7/10, particularly a great choice for sales.

Consider it a second campaign for DS 1 rather than a full sequel- if that's worth the price of admission for you, well, great!

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												The decline of the Horror Survival genre into an action shooter with horror elements can be seen in the transition from Dead Space 1 into 2. The Horror elements are reduced to jump scares and grotesque violence, rather than using the environment and our imaginations to install fear. There's less a sense of Isolation and Confusion as your lead by a carrot through hordes of monsters. The lack of any boss battles and over usage of quick time events are other shortcomings.

content:
Posted: April 30, 2012
												One of the best games I played. I played it for more than 10 times now and well, the developers didn't really care for fixing the game. The rubber foam bonus weapon unlock is not fixed, multiplayer could use some text chat and a push talk features. Enabling the microphone by default is annoying. You can hear static, annoying static.For personal preference, the game could use random enemy spawn similar to Left 4 Dead because after playing the game several times, it's easy to predict when and where the enemies will spawn. With random enemy spawning, the game will be less predictable and different every time you run through a corridor.For the graphics, it's great. The lighting engine is impressive, but there are some instances they cut corners to reduce graphical load for the console versions. For example, your helmet lights illuminate a totally dark room and it's totally absent in another area.Other than that, it's a great game and I highly recommend this to everyone.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2012
												I'm recommending you NOT buy this game if you have played the original, because in comparison it's almost an entirely different game from a storytelling point of view. For a start Isaac speaks, I'm all for storytelling but when you establish a franchise like this on the protagonist being silent it allows you the player to make up the character traits for yourself, like Gordon Freeman in Half-life; what is he like? what are his values? etc, in other words, Dead Space one allows you to BE the protagonist.  It works in Half Life, it works in Bioshock 1 and 2, it worked in System Shock and the original Dead Space.... now say goodbye to all that in Dead Space 2, because EA land you with a voice actor, now you CONTROL the protagonist; not as engaging.  The game is also very linear, do not expect to return anywhere you have previously explored, as it will probably be destoryed in some cut scene or the passage way blocked.  Lastly hardly any audio or video logs, mostly text.

content:

												I received a low-threat prisoner, so I didn't pay much attention to him. How wrong I was..It was a normal, average day. The prisoners were eating their lunch.. then it happened.He attacked from the shadows.Prisoner "Leeroy jenkins" viciously started stabbing my guards with his plastic fork. It was 5 against one.He'll never win, I thought.He'll never escape, I thought.He'll never survive, I thought.I thought wrong.He managed to start a full-scale riot, him and his army of offenders. They broke all 7 of my steel doors with their bare fists, escaping into the yard. They were almost out. I quickly hired God-knows-how-many dog handlers, in a valiant effort to hold them back until the authorities get here. I managed to keep the tsunami of prisoners back, put the prison on lockdown and finally the armed police got here.I did it, I stopped the riot.But then I saw that one particular cell was empty. Then I realized..LEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEROOOOOOOOOOOY JEEEENKINS!54/11 would plastic fork again.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												Just as the story page says, "THE NIGHTMARE RETURNS".Polished in every single way, overall DS2 is better than DS - increased fundings, experienced team and lots of inspiration and expectations made their trick, and I just got a lot of nice time - spending while playing Dead Space's ancestor. More action, more horror, more weapons, longer story line, more enemies, more locations, functional (but pretty dead for most times) multiplayer, and finally - Isaac Clarke can speak now, which is good too!DS2 is a perfect balance where devs found a golden middle between horror and action. Believe me, playing DS2 on normal difficulty IS challenging and have nothing to do with DS 1 Normal difficulty; here, at the middle of a game, I was starving for supplies, and each combat was unique since I had to use everything I could find to survive out there. Finding a medkit felt like a God's blessing. I don't even know what to expect from hardest difficulty, but that is gonna be a heck of a challenge for sure.Overall, this is one of these games you have to play if you consider yourself being a gamer. It's just... too good to miss it. P.S. Below you can watch a part of my silent walkthrough, feel free to check it out!


YouTube™ Video: Dead Space 2 [Part 01] (No commentary) 

			Views: 3		

			Here comes the turn for the ancestor, Dead Space 2! Lost, hollow, abandoned and broken, Isaac Clarke finds himself at the new place, but still locked with old nightmares.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
Dead Space 2 sees the return of CEC engineer Isaac Clarke into action. Waking up in a hospital shortly after a new Necromorph outbreak on the civilian space establishment called Titan Station, also known as The Sprawl, Isaac must now find out how he got there and escape his ordeal, as he makes some new friends, and, of course, new enemies along the way, including Nicole Brennan, his dead girlfriend hallucination fueled by The Marker.The game itself was similar to the first one, with a few exceptions like the slightly different story, the more frequent human contact and the considerable growth in terms of Necromorphs and locations variation. Dead Space 2 has also more weapons and suits than its predecessor, each suit having its own special bonus, alongside the increased inventory slots and damage resistance of each one. A thing to note here is that the Steam version of Dead Space 2 comes with all the DLC suits and weapons. A good thing you would say, but the downside to this is that all of them are available in the first store, in Chapter 1, for free. These suits can carry you just fine during your first playthrough, even on Zealot, the penultimate difficulty you can chose in the game (the last one is Hardcore, which you unlock after you finish the game once on any difficulty) and the weapons have special bonuses like shortened reloading time and increased primary/secondary damage which, again, can help to make your life easier, but for the sake of experience I would recommend you to wait a few chapters, at least, before grabbing them (no need to worry of spending the Nodes on a non-DLC weapon because the spent nodes on it carry over to the others of the same type). Another thing worth mentioning is that Nercomorph bodies disappear instantly if the body count exceeds, if I remember correctly, five, which can be annoying because, most of the times, you will need to stomp their bodies to get the loot, a thing that can be hardly accomplished during a big fight.The game was, nonetheless, as expected, very enjoying, even on the second playthrough (New Game plus). The newly introduced Necromorphs and the finely forged story portraying Isaac descent into dementia made this sequel as good as the first game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2011
												Dead Space 2 improves on the first game in almost every way. The story is more coherent and compelling, the action is more prevalent (without detracting from the survival-horror roots), the controls are smoother, and the voice acting, especially from the protagonist, is so good that it makes me yearn for a similarly vocal Clarke in the original.Also, contrary to my feelings on the first game, I found the side-characters to be very well-written and I really cared about the fates of the NPCs, including the villains.My only concern is that the game is too long for the format. There's only so much Necrmorph slaying one can indulge before it becomes repetative. And I feel that, like the first game, I hit that point about 5 or 6 hours into my 9 hour playing time.9/10

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
 Little Over view Look past all the hate towareds EA (i did before posting this) in a few words This game is AMAZING, but still falls flat in cirtain aspects, my main gripe with Dead Space 2 is that on the easyer difficultys its not very scary because you have lots of ammo and health packs, i highly suggest playing on a higher difficulty that limits thre recorces that you recive making fighting Necromorphs harder when ammunition and health is hard to come by making you leurn how to drop enemys without gut shotting them with the plasma cutter (it is possible to play ONLY using the plasma cutter, ammo is very common for it even on harder difficultys) Overall Look and Feel Despite this game's age  and style it is very pretty in places when looking out of windows over looking satern when your not fighting for your lifeSome of the indoor sections are dark and gloomy creating an atmosphere that is emersive and demands the player to be alert of their sroundings  because you dont know whats going to try and chop your legs off Comparrison to the original Dead Space In many ways Dead Space 2 is an improvments to the gameplay and story, yet it has partly lost some of its mystery to were the necromorphs have come from, but on the other hand it explains a lot and adds more to the story out waighing the negatives, Newer versions of necromorphs vary the combat making stasis more useful in combat other than just to make an escape in a tight squeeze when your outnumberd or ammoless,  Seeing the Ishimora again braught back happy/tence memorys of Dead SpaceShould you play it?YES!, Get this game but i HIGHLY suggest you get the first game aswell because it set up the story for this game (there is a "prevausly on dead space" but you would find it better to play though it yourself What would be your rating?If i was to give this game a rating, i would give it an 8.5 out of 10, there are is a lot of good yet some annoying design decisions that EA have made (such as oragin account needed to play on multiplayer, but i consider multiplayer unessasry when the singleplayer is so good), dont let the EA stuff phase you from getting this game (you can decline the sign in ever you start the game so it dosent force you like many people say), With a strong story, tight combat and fun gameplay i encorage you to get this game despite its small design flaws----Biz

content:
Posted: August 28, 2015
												I'm playing my third run through of this game (Very hard mode) and I absolutely love it. There's a lot that Dead Space 2 polishes up from its predecessor and tries to improve upon, however, the key component I feel was missed in DS2 from DS1 is the aspect of horror that was present in the first game - no matter how good your weapons were or how quick your trigger finger was, there was a tension that DS1 offered that left my palms sweating. Not to say that Dead Space 2 is a bad game - far from it. Graphically, animations are more fluid and the interior of the Sprawl is far more varied compared to DS1's USG Ishimura with environments spanning from your DS1-esque machinery and engineering environments, to shopping sections and even a school with multiple classrooms and playground.  This does not mean you can breathe easy though, DS2 still has many environmental hazards and introduces some new ones not present in DS1 and the Necromorphs are a more colorful mix of flavours as well adding several more enemies that are as deadly as the DS1 line-up. Of course, new enemies and a new ship to explore means more toys to wipe out the opposition, right? DS2 has reworked a few of the weapons from DS1, replacing secondary functions such as the Pulse Rifle's "Panic Barrage", as I call it from DS1, to an explosive payload that's good for ensuring nothing's left of the bodies you just stomped flat. New ones have stepped in as well such as the slow, but powerful Javelin Gun and if that isn't enough, more RIG suits that can give you a fighting chance when you're a sliver of health away from having yourself torn limb from limb and gutted like a fish. While the game is fantastic, it lacks the same degree of tension I encountered from the first, making up for it with an increased arsenal of firepower, more enemies, more deadly environments and more bloodshed. If you're going to buy this game, I recommend you buy the first one as well.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												Dead Space 2 is a great game, it is allot of fun to play. That being said I would like to point out some things I didnt like. When you get to the first store the game basicly throws you an upgraded version of every single wepon and armor. Some of you might think that this is awesome, you get every gun in the game for free, but to me it makes the game lose its magic. I first played the game on the Xbox 360 and my favorite part of the game is the fact that you have to be smart with your money and recorces in order to win. I would cary around a contact beam just so that i could sell its ammo for 1,000 credits when i reached the store. Every single time i would reach a store i would change from whatever suit i was wearing into the vintage suit just to make the prices go down, i would make my purcases and then change back to my previous suit. Since i carefully played the entire game like this it made newgame plus so rewarding because everything i had i earned. On this version of the game however i didnt get that experiance. I was basicly handed eerything i had worked so hard to get on the 360. As i mentioned at the begining this is a great game and i highly recomend it, but i wish that the free wepons and armor were only given to you after you beat the game once.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
												DEAD SPACE 2 : best one(10/10 A++++)ทิ้งห่างจากภาคแรกมากเยอะสัดๆ ผมบอกได้เลยว่าภาคนี้เป็นภาคที่เล่นแล้วสนุกสุด คือมันลงตัวอ่ะครบรส ทั้งสยอง ทั้้งแอคชั่น เออแม่งผสมเข้ากันอย่างดี ผมว่า deadspace 2 คือสิ่งที่ resident evil อยากจะเป็น แบบอยากจะแอคชั่นสนุกๆแต่ยังไม่อยากทิ้งความสยองที่เป็นเอกลักษณภาคนี้ยังคือไม่ทิ้งข้อดีของตัวเองคือ jumpscar กับบรรกาศสยองๆ แต่เพิ่มศัตรูให้เข้ามาปะทะตัวเรารอบด้านทำให้สนุกมากขึ้น นอกจากนั้นยังเปลื้ยนรอบแบบของเกม จากภาคแรกที่ผมไม่ค่อยชอบเรื่องการทำภารกิจแบบ เดินไปแล้วเดินกลับ ภาคนี้เขาเลยเปลื้ยนเป็นแบบเดินตะลุยทะลุด่านแบบเต็มตัวไม่ติดกับที่ๆใดที่หนึ่งนานๆ เออผมว่าดูเอาตัวรอดจริงๆมากกว่าระบบการเล่น: ไม่ค่อยต่างอะไรมากจากภาคแรก แต่เปลื้ยนการเดินของเกมที่ไม่จำเป็นต้องไปๆกลับ ตัวเกมสร้างสถานะการณ์การเอาตัวรอดได้ดีกว่าภาคแรกมาก ผมรู้สึกกดดันจริงๆเวลาที่เล่นภาคสอง ที่ชอบอีกอย่างคือระบบ suit ในภาคนี้้ที่ดูจะมีผลมากกว่าภาคแรก คือแบบ suit ในภาคแรกมันมีแค่เพิ่มค่าความอึด แต่ในภาคนี้ suit มันมีความแตกต่างเช่น suit นี้ซื้อของถูกขึ้น suit นี้เพิ่มช่องเก็บของบอสของเกมมีพัฒนามากขึ้นทำให้เราน่ากลัวและยากที่จะกำจัดภาพ: ไม่ต่างจากภาคแรกมมากนัก เพราะช่วงที่ออกมามันห่างกันไม่มาก ยังไม่ทิ้งข้อดีเรื่องแสงสีA.I. ฉลาดขึ้นมีการล่อหลอกยิง ศัตรูเยอะขึ้น เข้าปะทะรอบด้านทำให้เวลาสู้ต้องเอาหลังไปติดกำแพงตลอดข้อเสีย: หลักๆที่ผมเห็นเลยคือ ความยากของเกม ต้องบอกว่าภาคนี้เล่นยากมาก ทั้งกระสุน ทั้งศัตรูผู้เล่นใหม่ๆที่ไม่เคยเล่นภาคแรกมาก่อนอาจจะไม่ชินสรุป: ผมว่ามันพัฒนาขึ้นเยอะถึงแม้จะไม่กี่ปีก็ตาม ความกดดันมีมากขึ้น อาวุธมีการพัฒนาไม่ใช้ว่าปืนเดียวสามารถผ่านไปได้จนจบเกม การดำเนิดเรื่องค่อนข้างดี มีหักมุม ผมว่าภาคนี้เป็นภาคที่ดีที่สุดหละของเกมในซีรี่ย์นี้ มันครบรสถึงแม้ความสยองจะ drop ลงแต่ก็เพิ่มอะไรใหม่ๆเข้ามาแทนทำให้เกมดูน่าสนใจและเป็นที่น่าจดจำ นอกจากนั้นเกมยังเพิ่มความโหดเข้าไปอีกเป็น next level ด้วยฉากฆ่าเด็ก(เด็กผี)มีตั้งแต่ทารกยันเด็กโต โดยผมว่าเกมนี้ เป็นภาคที่ดีสุด เหมือนภาคแรกมันลองผิด ลองถูก แล้วพอมาเป็นภาคใหม่ เราเห็นพัฒนาการของมันที่มันกำจัดข้อเสียออกแล้วเพิ่มสิ่งใหม่เข้ามาไม่มากเกินไป ดูลงตัวและพอดีๆ

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
 Little Over view Look past all the hate towareds EA (i did before posting this) in a few words This game is AMAZING, but still falls flat in cirtain aspects, my main gripe with Dead Space 2 is that on the easyer difficultys its not very scary because you have lots of ammo and health packs, i highly suggest playing on a higher difficulty that limits thre recorces that you recive making fighting Necromorphs harder when ammunition and health is hard to come by making you leurn how to drop enemys without gut shotting them with the plasma cutter (it is possible to play ONLY using the plasma cutter, ammo is very common for it even on harder difficultys) Overall Look and Feel Despite this game's age  and style it is very pretty in places when looking out of windows over looking satern when your not fighting for your lifeSome of the indoor sections are dark and gloomy creating an atmosphere that is emersive and demands the player to be alert of their sroundings  because you dont know whats going to try and chop your legs off Comparrison to the original Dead Space In many ways Dead Space 2 is an improvments to the gameplay and story, yet it has partly lost some of its mystery to were the necromorphs have come from, but on the other hand it explains a lot and adds more to the story out waighing the negatives, Newer versions of necromorphs vary the combat making stasis more useful in combat other than just to make an escape in a tight squeeze when your outnumberd or ammoless,  Seeing the Ishimora again braught back happy/tence memorys of Dead SpaceShould you play it?YES!, Get this game but i HIGHLY suggest you get the first game aswell because it set up the story for this game (there is a "prevausly on dead space" but you would find it better to play though it yourself What would be your rating?If i was to give this game a rating, i would give it an 8.5 out of 10, there are is a lot of good yet some annoying design decisions that EA have made (such as oragin account needed to play on multiplayer, but i consider multiplayer unessasry when the singleplayer is so good), dont let the EA stuff phase you from getting this game (you can decline the sign in ever you start the game so it dosent force you like many people say), With a strong story, tight combat and fun gameplay i encorage you to get this game despite its small design flaws----Biz

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												as a player who came from dead space 3 and went back to 2 (i know, im special) this game is a real jump. playing DS3 is a rush, you get the creepiness mixed in with the overused action cuts, but coming on to #2 is a real good choice. I've somewhat touched on the story mode, but the multiplayer is quite fun. it has the Call of duty style level-up-and-get-new♥♥♥♥♥♥and stepping into the shoes of a necromorph is definatly a change of scenery and a great change to the game. the enemy variety certainly keeps you on your toes, from small packs of pac, to the flying infectors. the game has it's bosses, from the armored brute to issac's own mind. and its got those necromorphs that are put in there like the exploders and the exploder/lurker crossbreed thing. gameplay is a bit different from the third game, as im not seeing as many human enemies, and there isnt a real "sprint" (if there is, im officialy stupid) theres always the classic curbstomping and melee combat, and the weapons youre given vary a small bit, from the old plasma cutter, to the line gun and spear-shooty-thingy. the variety of weapons and enemies makes for a unique playstyle. i definatly see myself playing this again after i beat itand go play #3 it isnt as bad as people say it is, ya'll need to stop comparing it to this game. (shut up about how i just compared the two)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												Dead Space 2 is a great game, it is allot of fun to play. That being said I would like to point out some things I didnt like. When you get to the first store the game basicly throws you an upgraded version of every single wepon and armor. Some of you might think that this is awesome, you get every gun in the game for free, but to me it makes the game lose its magic. I first played the game on the Xbox 360 and my favorite part of the game is the fact that you have to be smart with your money and recorces in order to win. I would cary around a contact beam just so that i could sell its ammo for 1,000 credits when i reached the store. Every single time i would reach a store i would change from whatever suit i was wearing into the vintage suit just to make the prices go down, i would make my purcases and then change back to my previous suit. Since i carefully played the entire game like this it made newgame plus so rewarding because everything i had i earned. On this version of the game however i didnt get that experiance. I was basicly handed eerything i had worked so hard to get on the 360. As i mentioned at the begining this is a great game and i highly recomend it, but i wish that the free wepons and armor were only given to you after you beat the game once.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
												DEAD SPACE 2 : best one(10/10 A++++)ทิ้งห่างจากภาคแรกมากเยอะสัดๆ ผมบอกได้เลยว่าภาคนี้เป็นภาคที่เล่นแล้วสนุกสุด คือมันลงตัวอ่ะครบรส ทั้งสยอง ทั้้งแอคชั่น เออแม่งผสมเข้ากันอย่างดี ผมว่า deadspace 2 คือสิ่งที่ resident evil อยากจะเป็น แบบอยากจะแอคชั่นสนุกๆแต่ยังไม่อยากทิ้งความสยองที่เป็นเอกลักษณภาคนี้ยังคือไม่ทิ้งข้อดีของตัวเองคือ jumpscar กับบรรกาศสยองๆ แต่เพิ่มศัตรูให้เข้ามาปะทะตัวเรารอบด้านทำให้สนุกมากขึ้น นอกจากนั้นยังเปลื้ยนรอบแบบของเกม จากภาคแรกที่ผมไม่ค่อยชอบเรื่องการทำภารกิจแบบ เดินไปแล้วเดินกลับ ภาคนี้เขาเลยเปลื้ยนเป็นแบบเดินตะลุยทะลุด่านแบบเต็มตัวไม่ติดกับที่ๆใดที่หนึ่งนานๆ เออผมว่าดูเอาตัวรอดจริงๆมากกว่าระบบการเล่น: ไม่ค่อยต่างอะไรมากจากภาคแรก แต่เปลื้ยนการเดินของเกมที่ไม่จำเป็นต้องไปๆกลับ ตัวเกมสร้างสถานะการณ์การเอาตัวรอดได้ดีกว่าภาคแรกมาก ผมรู้สึกกดดันจริงๆเวลาที่เล่นภาคสอง ที่ชอบอีกอย่างคือระบบ suit ในภาคนี้้ที่ดูจะมีผลมากกว่าภาคแรก คือแบบ suit ในภาคแรกมันมีแค่เพิ่มค่าความอึด แต่ในภาคนี้ suit มันมีความแตกต่างเช่น suit นี้ซื้อของถูกขึ้น suit นี้เพิ่มช่องเก็บของบอสของเกมมีพัฒนามากขึ้นทำให้เราน่ากลัวและยากที่จะกำจัดภาพ: ไม่ต่างจากภาคแรกมมากนัก เพราะช่วงที่ออกมามันห่างกันไม่มาก ยังไม่ทิ้งข้อดีเรื่องแสงสีA.I. ฉลาดขึ้นมีการล่อหลอกยิง ศัตรูเยอะขึ้น เข้าปะทะรอบด้านทำให้เวลาสู้ต้องเอาหลังไปติดกำแพงตลอดข้อเสีย: หลักๆที่ผมเห็นเลยคือ ความยากของเกม ต้องบอกว่าภาคนี้เล่นยากมาก ทั้งกระสุน ทั้งศัตรูผู้เล่นใหม่ๆที่ไม่เคยเล่นภาคแรกมาก่อนอาจจะไม่ชินสรุป: ผมว่ามันพัฒนาขึ้นเยอะถึงแม้จะไม่กี่ปีก็ตาม ความกดดันมีมากขึ้น อาวุธมีการพัฒนาไม่ใช้ว่าปืนเดียวสามารถผ่านไปได้จนจบเกม การดำเนิดเรื่องค่อนข้างดี มีหักมุม ผมว่าภาคนี้เป็นภาคที่ดีที่สุดหละของเกมในซีรี่ย์นี้ มันครบรสถึงแม้ความสยองจะ drop ลงแต่ก็เพิ่มอะไรใหม่ๆเข้ามาแทนทำให้เกมดูน่าสนใจและเป็นที่น่าจดจำ นอกจากนั้นเกมยังเพิ่มความโหดเข้าไปอีกเป็น next level ด้วยฉากฆ่าเด็ก(เด็กผี)มีตั้งแต่ทารกยันเด็กโต โดยผมว่าเกมนี้ เป็นภาคที่ดีสุด เหมือนภาคแรกมันลองผิด ลองถูก แล้วพอมาเป็นภาคใหม่ เราเห็นพัฒนาการของมันที่มันกำจัดข้อเสียออกแล้วเพิ่มสิ่งใหม่เข้ามาไม่มากเกินไป ดูลงตัวและพอดีๆ

content:
Posted: May 26, 2013
												Well, let's get started.-This game is not scary... it's not. If you want a scary game play Amnesia-The story is quite good if you don't count couple of rushes.-Waaaaaay too many terrible "jump scares"-It repeats♥♥♥♥♥♥over and over. For example "Power surge" *Couple of monsters pop up* You better get used to it.-Difficulties seem to be broken. I'm playing on normal and it seems like it's on easy.-Boss battles are ♥♥♥♥♥♥-Suits are quite cool and each one has it's own benefits.-Ammo costs way too much. 1250 for 25 pulserounds? ♥♥♥♥ your♥♥♥♥♥♥-Seems like upgrading your gun doesn't do♥♥♥♥♥♥-Sometimes annoying level design, there is one part where you have to reaim solar panels and there are things flying perfectly in space...-The monsters are immune to the vaccuum of space. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t-Only a couple of characters with good voice acting.-And still. This game is not ♥♥♥♥ing scary. Seriously, it's desperately trying to scare you. Bodies dropping from the ceiling "♥♥♥♥ING SCARY!".Overall this game isn't bad. Just little bit wanky. Still worth a buy though. If it's 75% in discount.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2012
												It's okay. I didn't find it scary, but I didn't think the first was either. The action and gameplay is still solid, graphics look(ed) shiny, and the multiplayer appears fun though I have yet to try it. My major complaint with the game is the loading. I'd prefer a good old fashioned loading screen, rather than watch Issac sit in an elevator for 30 seconds. I don't have much to say, if you're a fan of Resident Evil 4, or god help you, RE5, you'll probably enjoy this. This just has an upgraded gameplay style of them and attempts to be scary. You might need an Origin account to play online since EA went to trash, but the game is still fine in Single Player. The game really felt a little like the fighting at the end was rushed, and the story was left open for a sequel. 8.5/10.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												as a player who came from dead space 3 and went back to 2 (i know, im special) this game is a real jump. playing DS3 is a rush, you get the creepiness mixed in with the overused action cuts, but coming on to #2 is a real good choice. I've somewhat touched on the story mode, but the multiplayer is quite fun. it has the Call of duty style level-up-and-get-new♥♥♥♥♥♥and stepping into the shoes of a necromorph is definatly a change of scenery and a great change to the game. the enemy variety certainly keeps you on your toes, from small packs of pac, to the flying infectors. the game has it's bosses, from the armored brute to issac's own mind. and its got those necromorphs that are put in there like the exploders and the exploder/lurker crossbreed thing. gameplay is a bit different from the third game, as im not seeing as many human enemies, and there isnt a real "sprint" (if there is, im officialy stupid) theres always the classic curbstomping and melee combat, and the weapons youre given vary a small bit, from the old plasma cutter, to the line gun and spear-shooty-thingy. the variety of weapons and enemies makes for a unique playstyle. i definatly see myself playing this again after i beat itand go play #3 it isnt as bad as people say it is, ya'll need to stop comparing it to this game. (shut up about how i just compared the two)

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
 Little Over view Look past all the hate towareds EA (i did before posting this) in a few words This game is AMAZING, but still falls flat in cirtain aspects, my main gripe with Dead Space 2 is that on the easyer difficultys its not very scary because you have lots of ammo and health packs, i highly suggest playing on a higher difficulty that limits thre recorces that you recive making fighting Necromorphs harder when ammunition and health is hard to come by making you leurn how to drop enemys without gut shotting them with the plasma cutter (it is possible to play ONLY using the plasma cutter, ammo is very common for it even on harder difficultys) Overall Look and Feel Despite this game's age  and style it is very pretty in places when looking out of windows over looking satern when your not fighting for your lifeSome of the indoor sections are dark and gloomy creating an atmosphere that is emersive and demands the player to be alert of their sroundings  because you dont know whats going to try and chop your legs off Comparrison to the original Dead Space In many ways Dead Space 2 is an improvments to the gameplay and story, yet it has partly lost some of its mystery to were the necromorphs have come from, but on the other hand it explains a lot and adds more to the story out waighing the negatives, Newer versions of necromorphs vary the combat making stasis more useful in combat other than just to make an escape in a tight squeeze when your outnumberd or ammoless,  Seeing the Ishimora again braught back happy/tence memorys of Dead SpaceShould you play it?YES!, Get this game but i HIGHLY suggest you get the first game aswell because it set up the story for this game (there is a "prevausly on dead space" but you would find it better to play though it yourself What would be your rating?If i was to give this game a rating, i would give it an 8.5 out of 10, there are is a lot of good yet some annoying design decisions that EA have made (such as oragin account needed to play on multiplayer, but i consider multiplayer unessasry when the singleplayer is so good), dont let the EA stuff phase you from getting this game (you can decline the sign in ever you start the game so it dosent force you like many people say), With a strong story, tight combat and fun gameplay i encorage you to get this game despite its small design flaws----Biz

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												An okay game. Basically the same game as Dead Space (1) but with a worse story. Satisfying combat and good UI, very well built environments. Making Isaac a non-anonymous protagonist was a bad decision, since before the story was somewhat excusable. This game suffers from the same problems as the previous, in that the jump scares becomes really predictable after a while. The story is basically built around the formula: get to X to escape, X is broken/blocked/gone, get to Y to escape instead, repeat.If all you want is more of the satisfying Dead Space combat, I can recommend this game. Otherwise you should probably play something else instead.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24
												Dead Space 2 is a great game 8.5/10!The story is pretty good 8/10. Several twists and turns. It sure helps to have played Dead Space first.The difficulty settings give is some extra play through value. Along with the option to start a new game with all the items you gathered in a previous game. 10/10The game is really linear 5/10. If you like linear games it's great, but I'd rather explore and have to figure out may way. If Dea Space 2 was an open wolrd (for the most part), being able to go all over an entire space station, where enemies could pop up at any moment, this game would get max score. Because it's linear the enemies have predefined appearances and so the second go around you know where the enemies pop up. Very much tied to a set story.If the story was more tree like, with other endings or outcomes this would really bring this game over the top, but it doesn't do that.The graphics are great, nuff said.The movement is a bit restrictive, but they do this to add to the horrer effect. It's great that the enemies move much faster than you, other wise you would be shocked when something pops out.Enemy variety is lacking 6/10. Later in the game you see the same monsters but with slightly different color that have more hitting power and health, but their tactics are the same. They should come up with better kill strategies that are more complex than just shooting, like adding some environmental things into a strategy to kill bosses.They need to have a bit more movement in the charater, like jumping, which is none existent. But the zero-gravity sections are great, where you get to fly around. I wish there were a lot more of this kind of stuff though. 7/10The game mechanics are good. 7/10 They have leveling of items and a growth tier system, so you have a sense of progression, unlike Gears of War. It's nice to have a progression system but it is minimum, they should have a bit more with regard to progression systems.Sounds are great 9/10Overall, dead space is a safe game to add to your collection. Most of these recommendations are for the devs who should build out the game a bit more to make it a stellar game.
